flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=28>>28 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 28 years x 2 = <<28*2=56>>56 years old.
This means, Tully is 56 years - 3 years = <<56-3=53>>53 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 53 years - 1 year = 52 years old last year.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 28. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
